faqs.question: How long does addiction treatment typically take?
faqs.answer: The duration varies depending on the type and severity of addiction, as well as individual needs. Many people benefit from 12-16 weeks of intensive treatment, followed by ongoing support. Recovery is a lifelong journey, and we're here to support you at every stage.

faqs.question: Do you work with both substance and behavioral addictions?
faqs.answer: Yes, we treat both substance addictions (alcohol, drugs, prescription medications) and behavioral addictions (gambling, gaming, shopping, food, etc.). The underlying principles of addiction treatment apply to both types.

faqs.question: What if I've tried treatment before and relapsed?
faqs.answer: Relapse is a common part of the recovery process and doesn't mean treatment failed. We work with you to understand what led to the relapse and develop stronger strategies for maintaining sobriety.

faqs.question: Do you offer medication-assisted treatment?
faqs.answer: While we don't prescribe medication, we can work collaboratively with your doctor or addiction specialist if medication-assisted treatment is part of your recovery plan.

faqs.question: Can you help with family members affected by addiction?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We provide support for families dealing with addiction, including education about addiction, setting healthy boundaries, and addressing codependency issues.

faqs.question: What if I'm not sure I'm ready to quit completely?
faqs.answer: We meet you where you are in your readiness for change. We can help you explore your relationship with the addictive behavior and work toward harm reduction or complete abstinence, depending on your goals.

faqs.question: Do you offer group therapy for addiction recovery?
faqs.answer: Yes, we offer both individual and group therapy for addiction recovery. Group therapy provides valuable peer support and helps you realize you're not alone in your struggles.

philosophy.title: Is Addiction Recovery Right For You?

sections.title: Understanding Addiction as a Complex Condition
sections.description: We view addiction as a complex condition that affects the brain, body, and spirit. Our approach recognizes that addiction often stems from underlying trauma, mental health issues, or unmet emotional needs. We work to address these root causes while supporting your recovery journey.

sections.title: Non-Judgmental, Compassionate Support
sections.description: We provide a safe, non-judgmental environment where you can be honest about your struggles without fear of shame or criticism. Recovery is a courageous journey, and we honor your strength in seeking help. Our compassionate approach helps you rebuild self-worth and hope.

sections.title: Evidence-Based Recovery Methods
sections.description: We combine proven therapeutic approaches including motivational interviewing, cognitive-behavioral therapy, and trauma-informed care. Our goal is to help you develop healthy coping mechanisms, build resilience, and create a sustainable recovery plan that works for your unique situation.

sections.title: Holistic Healing and Relapse Prevention
sections.description: We take a holistic approach to recovery, addressing physical, emotional, and spiritual well-being. We work with you to develop comprehensive relapse prevention strategies, build a strong support network, and create a meaningful life in recovery that supports your long-term sobriety.
